page.title: 06Baby Care _ Health Centre
page.content: We went to Guidepost Health Centre to find out how the children were treated. One four year old boy was there for his eye test. He was weighed and his height was recorded. Some babies were weighed, one was very heavy and then he was taken for an injection against whooping cough, tetanus and diphtheria. Then the next baby was weighed, he wasn't as heavy as the one before. He did not need an injection so that baby went home. The next baby came in and the mother gave the nurse a book. The book was a record about the baby. The baby's weight was recorded in it, it also had when the baby first smiles, when it starts to kick its feet about and more importantly when injections are due. Baby's hearing is tested.
